Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: STRING IDENTIFIER: Number or code uniquely identifying a production string withina well.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: BASE DEPTH: The depth of the deepest packer which directs the flow of reservoirfluids into the string.
Column Comment.5: BASE DEPTH OUOM: Base depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.6: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.7: COMMINGLED INDICATOR: Indicates whether the well string is comminglingproduction from more than one formation.
Column Comment.8: STATUS: The status of the well. For example: cased, spudded, licensed, dry,abandoned oil, gas, etc.
Column Comment.9: CURRENT STATUS DATE: Date of the current status for the well string.
Column Comment.10: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.11: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.12: FACILITY ID: Number or code uniquely identifying the Facility.
Column Comment.13: FACILITY TYPE: Identifies the codes classifying the facility according to its physicalequipment or principal service performed. Please note that FACILITY_TYPE willeventually become a SUBTYPE and downsized to 30 characters.
Column Comment.14: FIELD IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the field.
Column Comment.15: GOVERNMENT STRING IDENTIFIER: Number or code assigned by a regulatoryagency or government to identify a well string such as API or CPA number.
Column Comment.16: LEASE OR UNIT IDENTIFIER: Number or code assigned as an alias that uniquelyidentifies a lease or unit for production monitoring and reporting purposes.
Column Comment.17: ON INJECTION DATE: The date that injection was first reported for the productionstring.
Column Comment.18: ON PRODUCTION DATE: The date that production was first reported for theproduction string.
Column Comment.19: PLOT SYMBOL: A character or symbol used to represent a production string. Thismay be used in a particular mapping package coding scheme, or as a pointer to otherapplication dependent files.
Column Comment.20: POOL IDENTIFIER: Number or code uniquely identifying the pool. These pooldefinitions are created by a regulatory agency to facilitate reporting. An administrativepool may represent a group of completions (each of which is completed into ageologic pool) that are co-mingled. An administrative pool may also be created todivide a geological pool into smaller, more manageable segments for administrativepurposes. This relationship exists in the table PROD_STRING, where the POOL IDwill usually indicate the pool to which volumes are reported to a regulatory agency.The pool that is associated with the PROD STRING is usually administrative innature (associated with a comingling agreement).
Column Comment.21: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.22: PROD STRING TOTAL VERTICAL DEPTH: Absolute calculated vertical distancefrom surface to corresponding measured depth.
Column Comment.23: PRODUCTION STRING TOTAL VERTICAL DEPTH ORIGINAL UNITS OFMEASURE:
Column Comment.24: PROD STRING TYPE: Code indicating the type and/or status of the productionstring. The string could be abandoned, producing, disposal, injection, shut-in, etc..
Column Comment.25: PROFILE TYPE: The wellbore shape. For example vertical, horizontal, directional,s-shaped...
Column Comment.26: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.27: STATUS TYPE: The type of status reported for the well. Can include constructionstatus, operating status, producing status, abandonment status etc.
Column Comment.28: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.29: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.30: TAX CREDIT CODE: Code indicating the well qualifies for a tax credit. "C" = credit forthe well being permitted for coalbed methane gas.
Column Comment.31: TOP DEPTH: The depth of the highest packer which directs the flow of reservoirfluids into the string.
Column Comment.32: TOP DEPTH OUOM: Top depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.33: TOTAL DEPTH: The actual measurement along the well path from the referencedatum to the bottom of the production string
Column Comment.34: TOTAL DEPTH ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE
Column Comment.35: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.36: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.37: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.38: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.39: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.40: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.41: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
